#Text=Interview with Ton Roosendaal about Elephants Dream and free content movies
#Text=Sunday , May 21 , 2006

#Text=Three days after the Internet release of the free content 3D short Elephants Dream ( see Wikinews coverage ) , we exchanged e-mails with Ton Roosendaal about the reaction to the film , open source filmmaking , and the changes to Blender that resulted from the production .
#Text=Ton Roosendaal is the lead developer of the Blender 3D rendering and modelling software that was used for the movie .
#Text=He is also the chairman of the Blender Foundation , a non-profit organization which was formed in support of the software and projects like Elephants Dream .
#Text=How much money did the Blender Foundation spend on producing the movie ?
#Text=Has the money been fully recouped by DVD orders and donations ?
#Text=We still have to finish the final bookkeeping for this project .
#Text=It has been executed in co-production with the Netherlands Media Art Institute , and we each had our own internal budgeting for the project .
#Text=When you exclude expenses of pre-production and producer personnel , the total budget was about 120,000 â‚¬ , of which we covered half .
#Text=Our contribution was roughly covered half by the DVD sales , and half by European Union support ( http://www.uni-verse.org consortium ) .
#Text=One of the most common criticisms of CGI films is focus on technology over content .
#Text=For instance , Final Fantasy : The Spirits Within flopped with audiences , in spite of being an undisputed technical milestone .
#Text=I 've seen many reviews that criticized the plot of " Elephants Dream " as too bizarre or confusing .

column1: #Text=In retrospect , are you happy with the story development process ?
#Text=Haha , I knew the story and plot would get a mixed acclaim .
#Text=There 's a couple of reasons I 'd like to mention for it .
#Text=First of all ; the criticism resembles how people witness Blender itself , too .
#Text=Many people expect that Free Software is an easy accessible mass audience product .

#Text=We get a lot of complaints by non-artists that they ca n't get into the software easily , whilst the complexity of commercial products like Maya or Houdini is perceived as a confirmation of its " quality " .
#Text=Apparently an Open Movie created similar expectations with the audience .
#Text=Luckily we also got many positive reviews of the artistic result of the movie .
#Text=It is quite abstract , but definitely has many layers of information , inspiring many of the viewers to see relevant real life messages hidden here .
#Text=For this project we 've teamed up with the Netherlands Media Art Institute , internationally renowned as a resource for video art .
#Text=So for Elephants Dream , we 've had the luxury to challenge ourselves to create real independent artistic content as well .
#Text=The artists had a lot of freedom from the start ; they were responsible for the concept , story and creative development of the entire movie .
#Text=This has resulted in a lot of quite personal choices , based on what the artists liked to do themselves .
#Text=I really cherish such an approach , it has resulted in a very motivated team working crazy hours the last months to get it all realized .
